Summary •	High-powered multi-disciplinary engineering professional with extensive project experience from concept to development.  
•	Talents include ability to rapidly adapt to the task at hand, whether it involves hardware, software, or low-level firmware. 
•	Excellent analytical, diagnostic, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. Summary •	High-powered multi-disciplinary engineering professional with extensive project experience from concept to development.  
•	Talents include ability to rapidly adapt to the task at hand, whether it involves hardware, software, or low-level firmware. 
•	Excellent analytical, diagnostic, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. •	High-powered multi-disciplinary engineering professional with extensive project experience from concept to development.  
•	Talents include ability to rapidly adapt to the task at hand, whether it involves hardware, software, or low-level firmware. 
•	Excellent analytical, diagnostic, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. •	High-powered multi-disciplinary engineering professional with extensive project experience from concept to development.  
•	Talents include ability to rapidly adapt to the task at hand, whether it involves hardware, software, or low-level firmware. 
•	Excellent analytical, diagnostic, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills. Experience Automated Test Engineer Danfoss VLT Drives January 2006  – Present (9 years 8 months) Loves Park, IL Formulate and update appropriate Automated Test methodologies and protocols to challenge system functions against existing and evolving design requirements. 
Perform complex LabVIEW and Test Stand code design and system integration. Develop automation frameworks and test tools.  
Design and integrate Test Equipment and control circuit hardware. Work with clients on project needs and implement design into project. 
Execute automated and manual tests procedures that insure conformance to specification. Generate Test Report and provide root cause analysis for software/system problems identified 
Design documentation, including proposal and test implementation documents for SW validation work, schematics, wire lists. Test Design Engineer Caterpillar Inc. January 2003  –  January 2005  (2 years 1 month) Designed and implement End of Line Test (EOLT) systems for Automotive Electronics products. Activities included planning, traceability, de-bug and troubleshooting. Measurement systems are PC based using NI LabView software. 
Planed, developed, and performed testing/validation within area of assignment: Emphasis is placed on accuracy; accountability/ownership; adherence to internal and external standards, such as EC-1, ESD, EMI/RFI, collected data and generated Test Reports. 
Utilized hands-on experience in DSPs, microcontrollers, and programmable logic devices, digital and analog interfaces for PCs, scopes, DVMs, Network Analyzers to support analysis and testing of heavy trucks and componentry. Designed and built various Test Fixtures. 
Executed automated tests and performed measurements on and/or administer tests of components or systems using established processes and methodologies. Develop new testing processes and methodologies as required.  
Managed technical documentation, such as product requirements, test procedures and generated Test Reports. Experienced in automotive environmental, reliability, UL and CE safety standards. Manufacturing Test Engineer KLA-Tencor January 2000  –  January 2003  (3 years 1 month) Milpitas, CA Supported In-product and Final Test areas. Responsible for ECO release of project package. 
Designed and implemented to the manufacturing flow the test fixtures. 
Developed product testing methodologies and procedures. Generated Test Reports and performed data analysis. Validates and finalizes test operation methods sheets (TOMS).  
Identified issues and revised technical components of SOWs. Reviewed and assured technical compliance and safety. Created curriculum and conducts user training. Test Engineer Applied Materials January 1998  –  January 2000  (2 years 1 month) Santa Clara, CA Involved for system integration support vacuum equipment, such as CVD, PVD and CMP. Serve as advanced technical interface for groups and customer engineers.  
Leaded installation of the test fixture and de-bug efforts of fixture to the statement of work (SOW). 
Identified issues and revised components. Reviewed and assured technical compliance and safety.  
Performed advanced failure analysis, including verification of the failure and determination of the failure mechanism. Created and managed documentation. Conducted user training. Senior Customer Support Engineer Intel Corporation January 1995  –  January 1998  (3 years 1 month) Santa Clara, CA Involved for technical support of the Wafer Fabrication Capital Equipment such as Lithography (Microscan II+) and Wafers Development Lines for internal/external customers. 
Modified and evaluated electro-mechanical assemblies, electronics and optical components. Used quality tools, such as FRACAS, for data collection, root analysis and reporting.  
Designed, developed and implemented test fixtures to support production, inspection and service operations.
